title: Sampler, ca. 1800
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, satin, and herringbone stitches on plain weave foundation
provenance:
By 1945, Lily Wadsworth
1945 - 1981, Gertrude M. Oppenheimer
1981, Cooper-Hewitt Museum
description:
Unfinished mourning sampler with a tree and a woman at a tomb with a large urn of flowering vines on top of it. The woman's apron is caught in the branches of this vine. There is no inscription on the tomb, and the woman's head is drawn on the cloth but not embroidered. 
At the bottom, a text:
When age shall steal on me and youth is no more
And the moralist time shakes his glass at my door
When charm in lost beauty or wealth shall I find
My treasure my wealth is a sweet peace of mind

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, ca. 1800.
ca. 1800. Medium: silk embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, satin, and herringbone stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-155.
